original: ANGER, Folke, Samuel Jonatan, Direktör, Katrineholm, f Angered, Älvsb län, 12/1 06 av handl J A. Bengtsson o Axelina Pettersson, gm Sigrun Henke. Studex 24, Offex 27, inf.-off.sk 29—30, ljt Älvsb reg 31, kapt i res 41, aff- o språkstud Tyskl, Engl o Frankr 30—32, Berlins univ, Clarks Coll, London, Alliance Francaise, Paris, dipl eng spr o eng hdls-korresp o f komp att underv i ty o fr språken. Tjm hos AB Osram-Elektraverken, Sthlm, 32—34, avd.ch 34—36, förs.ch 36—37, sed. 37 vkst dir Gropptorps Marmor AB (gr 08, AB 18). Led stdsflm, dräts.kamm o ögl-Sörml hdlskamm. Styr.led Sv Stenind.frb, Groppt Marm AB, ordf Katrineh bowlinghall, styr.led Katrineh högerfrn o Sörml högerfrb. Resor: Tyskl, Engl, Frankr, Belg 30—39.
translated: ANGER, Folke, Samuel Jonatan, Director, Katrineholm, born in Angered, Älvsborg county, on January 12, 1906, son of merchant J.A. Bengtsson and Axelina Pettersson, married to Sigrun Henke. Graduated from high school in 1924, worked as an office clerk from 1927 to 1929, served in the infantry officer school from 1929 to 1930, a reserve officer in Älvsborg regiment from 1931, became captain in 1941. Conducted business and language studies in Germany, England, and France from 1930 to 1932, attended Berlin University, Clark's College in London, and Alliance Francaise in Paris, obtained diplomas in English language and English commercial correspondence, and professional competence to teach German and French languages. Employed at AB Osram-Elektraverken in Stockholm from 1932 to 1934, promoted to department chief from 1934 to 1936, served as sales director from 1936 to 1937, and has been managing director of Gropptorp Marble AB (established in 1908, became a limited company in 1918) since 1937. Member of the city film council, municipal finance committee, and board of the Sörmlands County Chamber of Commerce. Also serves on the board of the Swedish Stone Industry Association, Gropptorp Marble AB, and is chairman of the Katrineholm Bowling Hall, as well as a board member of the Katrineholm Conservative Party and Sörmland Conservative Association. Travelled extensively to Germany, England, France, and Belgium from 1930 to 1939.
